executive_summary: Tom Hayes is extremely bullish on small caps, midcaps, and international stocks, particularly Chinese equities like Alibaba. He believes the Magnificent 7 are overvalued and their earnings growth is decelerating, while the unmagnificent 493 offer better value with accelerating earnings growth. He is also bullish on housing-related stocks, particularly building suppliers, as well as regional banks and PayPal. He sees a potential for significant upside in Intel due to government support and a strong turnaround leader. He is bearish on Nvidia at current levels, citing supply constraints and valuation concerns. He is also bearish on FuboTV and Cava.

tom_current_conviction.overall_market: Constructive, favoring small caps, midcaps, and international.
key_reasons: Earnings growth reacceleration in the unmagnificent 493.
Potential for Fed rate cuts to boost interest rate sensitive sectors.
Undervaluation of Chinese equities and potential for foreign capital to return.

macro_thesis_summary: The market is undergoing a shift in leadership from the Magnificent 7 to the unmagnificent 493. Earnings growth is decelerating in the MAG7 while accelerating in the 493. Fed rate cuts will disproportionately benefit interest rate sensitive sectors like housing and small caps. Chinese equities are undervalued and poised for a rally driven by domestic and eventually foreign capital.

key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: This is the key divergence that people haven't dialed into yet. You want to go for accelerating at half the multiple.
You're paying 33 times still for declining earnings growth.

key_macro_data_points.indicator: China Allocations in Active Funds Globally
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: Missed the entire rally. Unbelievable. They are going to be chasing when Alibaba's 250 and 300.
Gives reason to think new vehicle sales will rise in the next few years.

Alibaba.thesis_summary: Alibaba is a proxy for Chinese AI and the toll taker of the middle-class recovery and pivot toward consumption. The stock is undervalued and poised for a rally driven by domestic and eventually foreign capital.
key_metrics: AI related product revenue posted triple-digit growth for the eighth straight quarter.
Trades at 17 times earnings with analysts now pricing in 31.2% earnings growth for next year.

Intel.thesis_summary: Intel is a dark horse in the AI game and is poised for a turnaround due to government support, a strong turnaround leader (Lip Boutan), and the need for diversified chip manufacturing capacity. Downside protected, upside unlimited.
key_metrics: Government support and funding for the Arizona 18A node.
Lip Boutan's track record of turning around Cadence Design Systems.
Intel.price_target_or_valuation: If half of what they say is going to work, you wind up with 80, 100 or more per share.

Disney.thesis_summary: Disney is back to doing what it does best, creating blockbuster hits. Record free cash flow and subscriber growth. The company's three-year target of sustaining doubledigit earnings growth through 2027 remains firmly intact.
key_metrics: Adjusted EPS crushed expectations at 1.61, well above the 1.45, up 16% year-on-year earnings growth.
Direct to consumer delivered another strong corner, rising 6% year-on-year to 6.18 billion.
Year-to date free cash flow stands at 7.52 billion, up nearly three billion from the LA same time last year, pushing trailing 12 month free cash flow to a record 11.5 billion.
Disney.price_target_or_valuation: Nowhere near done with its move.

risks_and_contrarian_flags: Potential for Trump's tariffs to be overturned in court (though unlikely).
Risk of disintermediation in technology businesses.
technical_takeaways: The surge is going to be more felt in individual names versus the quote unquote MAG7 index index aka S&P 500 which is why we underwrite each company.
